verses.text: In the eighth month , in the second year of Darius , came the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* unto Zechariah , the son of Berechiah , the son of Iddo the prophet , saying ,
The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath been sore displeased with your fathers.\f + \fr 1.2 \ft sore…: Heb. with displeasure\f*

Therefore say thou unto them, Thus saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* of hosts ; Turn ye unto me, saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* of hosts , and I will turn unto you, saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* of hosts.

Be ye not as your fathers , unto whom the former prophets have cried , saying , Thus saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* of hosts ; Turn ye now from your evil ways , and \add from\add* your evil doings : but they did not hear , nor hearken unto me, saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*.
Your fathers , where \add are\add* they? and the prophets , do they live for ever ?

But my words and my statutes , which I commanded my servants the prophets , did they not take hold of your fathers ? and they returned and said , Like as the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts thought to do unto us, according to our ways , and according to our doings , so hath he dealt with us.\f + \fr 1.6 \ft take…: or, overtake\f* \p

¶ Upon the four and twentieth day of the eleventh month , which \add is\add* the month Sebat , in the second year of Darius , came the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* unto Zechariah , the son of Berechiah , the son of Iddo the prophet , saying ,

I saw by night , and behold a man riding upon a red horse , and he stood among the myrtle trees that \add were\add* in the bottom ; and behind him \add were there\add* red horses , speckled , and white.\f + \fr 1.8 \ft speckled: or, bay\f*
Then said I, O my lord , what \add are\add* these? And the angel that talked with me said unto me, I will shew thee what these \add be\add*.
And the man that stood among the myrtle trees answered and said , These \add are they\add* whom the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath sent to walk to and fro through the earth.

And they answered the angel of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* that stood among the myrtle trees , and said , We have walked to and fro through the earth , and, behold, all the earth sitteth still , and is at rest. \p

¶ Then the angel of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* answered and said , O 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* of hosts , how long wilt thou not have mercy on Jerusalem and on the cities of Judah , against which thou hast had indignation these threescore and ten years ?
And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* answered the angel that talked with me \add with\add* good words \add and\add* comfortable words.
So the angel that communed with me said unto me, Cry thou, saying , Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts ; I am jealous for Jerusalem and for Zion with a great jealousy.
And I am very sore displeased with the heathen \add that are\add* at ease : for I was but a little displeased , and they helped forward the affliction.

Therefore thus saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*; I am returned to Jerusalem with mercies : my house shall be built in it, saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* of hosts , and a line shall be stretched forth upon Jerusalem.

Cry yet, saying , Thus saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* of hosts ; My cities through prosperity shall yet be spread abroad ; and the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* shall yet comfort Zion , and shall yet choose Jerusalem.  +  r 1.17  t prosperity: Heb. good * \p
¶ Then lifted I up mine eyes , and saw , and behold four horns.
And I said unto the angel that talked with me, What \add be\add* these? And he answered me, These \add are\add* the horns which have scattered Judah , Israel , and Jerusalem.
And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* shewed me four carpenters.

Then said I, What come these to do ? And he spake , saying , These \add are\add* the horns which have scattered Judah , so that no man did lift up his head : but these are come to fray them, to cast out the horns of the Gentiles , which lifted up \add their\add* horn over the land of Judah to scatter it.
